page.title: 06Farming - Loss of Landwork
page.content: Although the{Vale}had all the advantages of climate, soils, transport services and markets, the field crops are now grown more economically with modern mechanised methods on the large acreages in Lincolnshire and the Fens. In{Vale} villages, like ours, this means that landwork locally is no longer available and work must be found in shops and industry in nearby towns. It does seem a pity that in an area with so many positive advantages and back up services, as well as{Pershore {College,}that horticulture is not a more important subject in the local High Schools.The industry needs young people with brains and energy, to train and use modern techniques, to compete effectively with those sending imports into the U.K. from other E.E.C. countries.
